comments:
1. Create a new project.
2. File-->Import-->Zip File.  Specify a jar that just has class files.
3. Now select all the packages in your new project and try to delete them.  Nothing happens - the
	packages are not removed.  Select an individual package.  Try to delete it.  It is not removed.
	The only way to get rid of the packages is in the Resources View.  Is this the intent???

4. File-->Import-->Zip File.  Specify the jar in Step 2.  Make sure overwrite without warning is checked.
	At one point I got duplicate packages.  Cannot recreate the duplication problem.  Not sure what
	state I was in.  I was going back and forth between the Java Perspective and the Resources
	Perspective.

NOTES:
EG (24.07.2001 21:24:14)	
	there is a fix for 1.0 in build 127 for not being able to delete a package.
	need to verify that this addresses the problem.
can't reproduce in the latest - closing

reproduce it - attached a zip file (import it)
the problem is that, after you import the zip file, you see 2 folders:
META-INF
META-INF

the first one is reported as a package (sic!)
the other one correctly as a folder.
selecting both and hitting 'delete' results in the assertion failure - it 
simply tries to delete the same thing twice.
moving to Erich's inbox - the problem comes from the package viewer displaying
